meanings.definition: To drink alcohol quickly or in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: At the party, he skoaled his drink in one gulp.
meanings.sent2: They skoaled to celebrate their friend's promotion.
meanings.sent3: The group skoaled to the success of their escape room challenge.
meanings.sent4: She skoaled down her worries with each sip of wine.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy skoaled his whiskey before riding off into the sunset.

meanings.definition: To toast or celebrate with a drink.
meanings.sent1: Let's skoal to the happy couple at the wedding!
meanings.sent2: They skoaled with champagne to mark the new year.
meanings.sent3: The team skoaled to their victory in the championship game.
meanings.sent4: She skoaled with her friends to the end of a great vacation.
meanings.sent5: The students skoaled with soda to their successful science project.

meanings.definition: To consume or finish something quickly.
meanings.sent1: He skoaled his sandwich before rushing to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The kids skoaled their ice cream before it melted.
meanings.sent3: She skoaled the last piece of cake before anyone else could grab it.
meanings.sent4: The team skoaled the pizza in minutes during their lunch break.
meanings.sent5: The hungry dog skoaled his food as soon as it was placed in front of him.
